items.title: Agri Picks Report April 07, 2025: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit Financial Services, Sowing of rabi crops in Telangana was at 7.6 million acres (1 acre = 0.4 hectares) as of Wednesday, up 13.2% on year from 6.7 million acres sown in the same period last year, according to a report released by the state agriculture department.

items.title: NHPC commissions long delayed projects, investors should note cost overruns
items.description: Addition of the under-construction hydroelectric projects will significantly boost NHPC’s regulated equity base.

items.title: Live: Nifty Braces For Impact After Big Wall Street Crash| Nasdaq Enters Bear Market| Opening Bell
items.description: Indian market is bracing for a manic Monday as Asian markets are selling off, the GIFT Nifty is down over 800 points. US futures under pressure after indices posted their worst-day ever on Friday since 2020 as China announced retaliatory tariffs, escalating a global trade war. Dow ends in correction slipping over 2,200 points while the S&P & Nasdaq ended lower by nearly 6% each. 10-year treasury yield sees the biggest weekly drop in 8 months. How should you position yourself now and is there a place top hide? Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Rajesh Palviya, Senior VP-Research, Head -  Technical & Derivatives Axis Securities and Daljit Singh Kohli, Head-Equity, Roha Asset Managers .

items.title: Chart of the Day | Financial maturity of Indian investors
items.description: While the growing interest in equities among retail investors is all too evident, the key question is whether their behaviour has become more mature or not

items.title: IndusInd Bank shares in focus on mixed Q4 business update, UBS cuts target price
items.description: UBS maintained its ‘Sell’ rating on IndusInd Bank and reduced its price target on the stock by 22 percent

items.title: Puravankara shares in focus on winning project worth Rs 118 crore
items.description: Puravankara Share Price | The share price declined more than 55 percent in the last one year. The share touched a 52-week high of Rs 565.00 and a 52-week low of Rs 215.35 on 03 July, 2024 and 19 February, 2025, respectively.

items.title: AstraZeneca Pharma shares likely to break 4-day losing streak on approval for cancer drug
items.description: AstraZeneca Pharma India Share Price | Market capitalisation stands at Rs 19,771.25 crore. The share touched a 52-week high of Rs 9,049.95 and a 52-week low of Rs 5,000 on 24 March, 2025 and 08 May, 2024, respectively.

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: Market crashes; Nifty below 21,900, Sensex plunges 2,600 pts
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: Trent, Tata Steel, JSW Steel, Tata Motors and ONGC were among major losers on the Nifty. All the sectoral indices are trading in the red with IT and metal down 7 percent each. BSE Midcap and smallcap indices down 6 percent each.

items.title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
items.description: The Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) remained net sellers for fifth consecutive session on April 4 as they sold equities worth Rs 3483 crore. On the other hand, after remaining net buyers in the last five days, Domestic institutional investors (DIIs) sold equities of Rs 1720 crore on the same day.

items.title: Trade Spotlight: How should you trade Max Financial, Tata Consumer Products, MCX India, Tata Chemicals, HDFC Bank, and others on April 7?
items.description: The market is expected to see more weakness in the upcoming sessions, given the dismal global cues. Below are some trading ideas for the near term.

items.title: Mazagon Dock shares crash 10%, drop below govt's OFS floor price
items.description: The shares of the PSU defence company have so far fallen over 13 percent in the last five sessions and nearly 22 percent from the 52-week high level.

items.title: Bajaj Housing shares decline 5% despite 25% growth in gross disbursement in Q4FY25
items.description: The company reported a 26% year-on-year jump in assets under management and healthy loan disbursements of Rs 14,250 crore for the March quarter

items.title: Siemens India shares surge 20% on ex-date for energy business spin-off
items.description: Shareholders will get one share of Siemens Energy India for every Siemens India share they own

items.title: All 6 Tata Group stocks in Nifty 50 tumble, erase over Rs 1 lakh crore in m-cap
items.description: Trent emerged as the biggest loser on the index, with its shares plunging as much as 19 percent

items.title: Tariff tremors dent shares of Kalyan Jewellers despite a 37% revenue growth in March quarter
items.description: Kalyan Jewellers has shared a strong revenue growth in its business update, with the surge in India business driven by a robust wedding demand, however, the shares were under pressure, in-line with the weakness in the broader market.

items.title: Banking shares drag Nifty Bank lower by 3% as Trump tariffs trigger recession fears
items.description: ICICI Bank shares fall 4%, while HDFC Bank shares are down 3% contributing the most to the decline on Nifty Bank index.

items.title: Midcaps, smallcaps crumble as tariff shock, US recession fears rattle investors
items.description: Every single stock within the Nifty Midcap 100 and Nifty Smallcap 100 universes was trading in negative territory

items.title: Tata Steel hits lower circuit, Metal index down 7% as Trump tariff rattles Dalal Street
items.description: The fall in metal stocks is in-line with overall market weakness, after US President Trump's reciprocal tariffs and China's retaliation rattled global markets and triggered fears of a trade war.
